column2: Satisfied, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: If you are overweight and in good health this is the medicine you need! The appetite suppressing effects that this medicine has is unbelievable and that was my main problem with losing weight. I always always overate at meals and then snacked constantly on junk food throughout the day. The amount of calories I consumed in a day was probably twice the "suggested" amount. When I take phendimetrazine it completely stifles that hungry feeling that made me graze all day long and the boost of energy really keeps you moving. You won't be able to sit still, which is great!

column2: Phen for Me?, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Started taking phendimetrazine last Tuesday...opted to be part of a study that a friend of mine told me about. I'm 5'9, 144lbs - by no means overweight. Yet, I was trying to shed just 10-15lbs to get back down to the weight I once loved and felt my best at. 2 a day/hour before meals. First day it surpressed my appetite and I was more than a little surprised - thought I hit the jackpot, as I am the queen of snacking throughout the day. 2nd and 3rd day didn't work as well as the first, 4th and 5th day worked good again. Now I'm on my 7th day and today it hardly worked. Not sure what all the back and forth is about because I haven't done anything different. I will say that I've dropped 4lbs in the past week, but I'm also taking water pills :/

column2: ValsGal77, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started out at 289 pounds! Have been on this medicine for 9 days and have lost 13 pounds. Increased energy is GREAT! Haven't felt this good in years.  Maintaining my usual moderate excercise but now have no more increased appetite. I am maintaing a 1200 or less calorie diet. This is a lifesaver for me!

column2: dana1, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started this drug March 17 with a starting weight of 227.  I take the 35mg tablets....2 tablets... 3 times a day.  I also am trying to stay around 1200 calories and day and do at least 30 minutes of cardio at least 4-5 days a week.  In 5 weeks I have lost 17 pounds.  I have tried other diet pills in the past but I feel this one works best for me.  Have not really had any side effects.  If you are ready to limit your calorie intake and commit to exercising this pill should work great for you.....it has for me!!!!

column2: Lady Bug, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking 105 mg every morning around 8am then I eat breakfast.  I have started getting hungry in the afternoon.  I have no side effects at all.

column2: PHENDIMETRAZINE, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: When taking this drug along with a low calorie diet I was able to lose 15% of my weight in a 4 month period.

column2: me, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: If anything this medication has made me more lethargic and caused increase weight gain. I take 35 mg 2 times daily and never experienced any appetite suppressing qualities or increased metabolic reactions. Is this a placebo?

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this treatment is awsome.  I love drugs.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started my diet on April 1st of 2009 and it is now july 1st and I have lost 47 pounds, only 3 months! At first the pills did make me jittery and hyper, they still make me a bit hyper but it could be energy from dropping all the weight. After the first week on the pills the side effects went away and I am perfectly fine. Sometime's I forget to take the pill, but in the long run, it helps with my cravings and how much food I do eat. My stomach has shrank and my portions are a lot smaller, but this is also in good aid of my weight lose programm, I am under supervision and I beleive not only is it the pills but the low carb, fat and exercise as well. This is most improtant otherwise like any diet or diet aid once you get off and you eat like you used to, it will come back. Anyone taking this pill must know that if given it, it is because they are basically considered morbid obese, the pills is a miracle drug but YOU HAVE TO know that your diet is going to be changed forever, otherwise once off it, the weight will come back. It is the best jump start I have ever had, since I have tried my whole life just to loose some weight, in three months I have lost half of my dream weight goal! Drink A LOT of water, A LOT!And best used under supervision, most clinics or places that provide this medication give you a blood test and EKG before administering the pill to its patients. Other than that, I love them and am glad I was introduced to them! They are a miracle for me!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
imcandycrazee, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been taking this diet pill for about 20 days now.  I take 1 pill at 10:00 am 105mg amd then another at 3:00 pm 35mg.  The only thing that I've noticed is I get headaches occassionally and my best friend said she has noticed that I am not myself.  I'm usually an upbeat person, but she says I'm kind ho hum lately.  Anybody else have these symptoms and what kind of success rate are you guys getting from this diet pill?

column2: MiRi, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The first time i used it i did lose weight, about 20 lbs in 2 months. I tried using it again after 3 months and the first few days it worked great but then it seemed to lose its effectiveness after a month or so on it. Side effects were thirst, anxiety (made me want to smoke!)and insomnia. Overall it worked but only short term and can be sort of addicting because when i would miss a day i would feel something was missing in my body...this is my last month. I weigh 177.

column2: HAPPY CAMPER, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had went on Weight watchers and lost 70 pounds with diet alone. I started slipping around October 08 and over the holidays, gained back 25 pounds. I was sick with myself. I weighed 245 in the beginning and lost down to 175. I tried so hard to get back on track but, I just could not control my hunger cravings at all. I was so disgusted with myself that I ate even more. So, I went to a docter and got these pills and so far I have been hunger free. I can't believe how easy it is to say no to ice cream and cakes. Do not even want it. I do have dry mouth but, I am willing to live with that. I have only been on them 1 week and have lost 10 pounds so far. I am in love with the results and am looking forward to seeing 175 again. Hopefully I will get to see 150 one day, which is my ideal weight that I haven't been since high school. I would definately recommend this drug to anyone that needs to lose weight.

column2: tuckerm41@aol.com, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
mistys190, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i started this on wed jan 28 2009 1 lost 4 pounds i also take b-12 shot from my doctor i do believe that this is going to make the difference. and im glad to say no side effects at this time but i will keep u updated

column2: alias, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have alot of energy during the day. Eating is the last thing on my mind. I actually have to force myself to eat because I forget. My mouth is dry most of the time, so a bottle of water is always insight. It stopped all my cravings, including SMOKING! i used to smoke cigarrettes alot until I started taking the medication & it stopped it all together. Couldnt be more satisfied.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
kdpeebles, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: helped control my hunger, had lots of energy.  Only adverse effect is hair loss which has been about 50%.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had taken Adipex as a diet aid and found it to make me jittery.  I like this option much better, by allowing me up to three pills a day I am more in control than with an extended release pill.  I have not felt jittery or edgy.  I typically do not take but 2 a day.  It definitely takes away hunger issues and boosts energy.

column2: Lisa, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have now been on this medication for about six months on and off I was really good with the diet and exercise in the beginning and now I am slacking a little but the medication still works when I take it I started at a weight of 294 pounds and now weigh 237 I have almost lost 60 pounds in 6 months this is a wonder drug it works great I would recomend it to someone that really needs to take off a few extra pounds...

column2: kshepherd21, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this drug for approx. 1 month.  In addition to taking this drug, along with exercise and diet control I have lost 20 pounds.

column2: lisa, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have now been on this med for about 40 days and have lost a total of 32 pounds It works wonderfull I would recomend this to anyone that is willing and commited to lossing weight.

column2: lampsedison, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
granny, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After just two weeks, I have lost 6 pounds. Dieting has always been hard for me because of food cravings. This medication eliminates that factor.

column2: lisa, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on this drug for three weeks already and have lost a total of 21 pounds so far This is an average of 1 pound a day this is wonderfull I have no side affects at all. Lots of energy I go to the Gym at least six days a week and have a 1200 calorie diet. Good luck to all if you try this medication

column2: Lisa, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for 6 days and have lost almost 9 pounds already the pill is a miricle drug.  I could not sleep the first night at all, but I sleep well now.  All I am doing is going to the gym every day and doing an hour of cardiovascular activity and limiting my caloric intake to 1200 calories most days I dont even have all calories allowed the pill works great for craving hunger and It gives me so much energy all day long.  All I can tell everyone is make sure you exercise everyday and you will see results fast.  Good luck to all of you I will post another comment in a week or so.

column2: alonsogirl1981, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just started this medication and I can tell a difference already!

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: goal was to lose 50 lbs, in my 9th week,I have 14 lbs to go.without the RX I doubt I could have stayed on low food intake.i experienced no ill effects, small meals were satisfying,while on this RX

column2: (Patient)
column9: overwieght

column2: nobody, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I feel no hunger at all and no side effects for now. I do not know how I will feel later as I have just started taking this drug. But because I do not feel any hunger I find it difficult to eat anything and that is just amazing since I have been severly obese (nearly 300 pounds) for the biggest part of my life. This drug may just save my life.

column2: believer, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was in a car wreck and had back and knee injuries. I was overweight and my doctor prescribed this drug along with a low-carb diet and lots of green vegetables. I lost 35 pounds in 6 weeks---- (went from 210 lbs to 175 lbs) without exercise, as my doctor was monitoring my back condition and hoping to avoid performing back surgery. Along with a supplemental b-12 vitamin I could not believe how quickly the weight dropped off me. It took a little will power to stay away from the carbs, but with this drug I did not feel hungry---but thirsty most of the time. I was drinking a gallon of water a day and not having to force myself to do it.

column9: Lost 18 pounds in three weeks followed the diet and worked out three time a week.
